snippet: Behind the scenes, Volkswagen’s main complaint involved the diesel engines it is accused of rigging, according to a former official at the Environmental Protection Agency.

byline.contributor: Jack Ewing contributed reporting from Frankfurt and Bill Vlasic from Detroit.

abstract: Environmental Protection Agency officials say Volkswagen's boycott of Pres Obama's July 2011 announcement of fuel economy and carbon emissions targets was motivated by company's belief that its diesel engines were being overlooked as viable alternative to zero-emission electric cars and should receive special fuel economy credits; one of biggest proponents of diesel engines within company was executive Wolfgang Hatz, who has since been suspended in connection with company's emissions scandal.
lead_paragraph: Behind the scenes, Volkswagen’s main complaint involved the diesel engines it is accused of rigging, according to a former official at the Environmental Protection Agency.

headline.print_headline: Volkswagen Sought a Green Seal for Its Diesel Cars
headline.main: Volkswagen Sought a Green Seal for Its Diesel Cars
